campaign.story:
That’s exactly what this is!
Shut Up & Sit Down, the best board game site on the entire internet, has teamed up with the party game professionals at Big Potato Games. Together, we’ve created a brand-new edition of Don’t Get Got with 120 new missions and an aggressively orange colour scheme.
If you don’t own Don’t Get Got, that’s perfect. Included in this £20 box is everything you need to play.
If you DO own Don’t Get Got, that’s perfect too! Think of this box as a very generous expansion, doubling the amount of missions in the base game and letting you play with up to 20 players. Imagine that! It would be carnage.
Check out SU&SD’s glowing review!
Are you the kind of hotshot who doesn’t have 10 minutes to watch a video? Not a problem, here’s a quick gif-stuffed overview:
Don’t Get Got is a game of secret missions for 2-10 players, and it takes place while you go about your day. Perfect places to break out Don’t Get Got would be living with housemates, at work, on holiday, at parties, even at gaming conventions.
Each player receives a cute little wallet full of unique missions, and then you just get back to living your life, except you’re immediately going to start scheming like a mean scheme machine:
Hand out some random missions to each player
Each mission will tell you what you’ve got to try and trick the other players into doing...
Read and insert the missions into your wallet
Each time you succeed at this you get to (a) flip over the little mission in your wallet, which is super satisfying:
Nailed it!
and (b) reveal your mission to the player who just got got, which is even more satisfying:
Point and rejoice
But there’s a catch! If you ever get caught (which is as easy as another player asking if you’re trying to trick them), that mission is flipped over to the “FAILED IT” side for the rest of the game.
Failed it :'(
The first player to complete 3 missions wins!
Victory
The writers at Shut Up & Sit Down have had a great time creating new expansions for some of their favourite party games, like Monikers and The Metagame. When Big Potato asked if we wanted to design a brand-new box for Don’t Get Got, we leapt at the chance.
Included in this Shut Up & Sit Down Special Edition are 10 plastic wallets, 1 collectible sticker and 120 missions, all of which were painstakingly entered into a spreadsheet by team SU&SD.
In all seriousness, we worked super hard on this, and went through several rounds of refinement and feedback with the original game’s designers. The perfect Don’t Get Got mission makes you smile when you receive it, and represents an interesting, open-ended puzzle as to how exactly you’re going to pull it off. We aimed to deliver that with each and every mission.


But of course not! With enough pledges we will reveal not one, not five, but three stretchy goals that we’d like to offer all of our backers for absolutely free.
You took that poor target and smashed it into pieces!
As a reward, you’ve unlocked the ‘EPIC MISSIONS’ pack — 20 Kickstarter-exclusive missions that require so much forethought, even a criminal mastermind would wince at them.
Surprise extra stretchy goal unlocked! 
We messed up with the shipping, so here’s something to say sorry — all the cards from the original Don’t Get Got game. That’s 186 extra missions, carefully placed inside each and every copy of the Kickstarter special edition.
You want the rest? Well guess what, you can’t handle the rest!
Only joking, of course you can. Introducing the ‘GAME NIGHT’ pack — 20 Kickstarter-exclusive missions, all designed to be played while you’re playing another board game. How meta are we?
You’ve unlocked this year’s hottest fashion accessory!
Fresh from the catwalks of Milan, it’s the SU&SD x Big Potato pin badge. Whether you pin it to your bag, your ear or your fancy lapels, everyone will know you backed the hottest game around (and that you might be up to something sneaky).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
It should be a relief to anyone who’s watched team SU&SD finger board game components into their mouths that they won’t be involved in manufacturing or fulfilment at all.

Instead, publishing and manufacturing will be handled by Big Potato Games, who have published over 50 games and distributed to countries all over the world. They have literally shipped out more games than you’ve had hot dinners. We're using Blackbox as our fulfilment service who are the complete bomb and we trust with all of our possessions.

Additionally, the copy of this Special Edition that you can see in the Kickstarter video is a near-final copy sent to us directly from the manufacturers, so all we need to do is tell them how many more copies to make. That’s why you can expect your copy of this edition as early as April 2021.


Thank you so much, everybody. 

Sincerely,

SU&SD and Big Potato

updates.update_content:
Around two weeks ago, we promised we’d be in touch with an update on shipping, to keep everyone’s minds at ease. Well, here it is: 

Everything is going exactly as planned… more or less!

Originally, we told everyone that the games would be arriving at the very end of May, but of course, they were never all going to arrive at the exact same time. A lot of you have already received your games (and we hope that your sneak skills are already maxed out), but there’s still some of you waiting. So, please refer to this handy guide from the factory:

updates.update_userinfo: AN UPDATE ON SHIPPING (AND EVERYTHING ELSE)
updates.update_content:
Hello

We’ll start with the “Everything Else”.

A few weeks ago, we asked you for your phone number. What we should’ve done is explain WHY we need it and WHAT we’ll be doing with it.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE: GETTING THE GAMES OUT OF CHINA
updates.update_content:
It’s been around a month-ish since our last update and you’ve probably got two big questions:
WHERE are the games?
WHEN am I getting them?
Well luckily, we’ve got answers for both. All the games are more or less finished — they’re just stuck in China, queuing to leave the factory. According to the latest news from our manufacturing partners, the games are scheduled to ship out of the factory on .

Hello,

It’s been a while since we’ve spoken, but rest assured, we haven’t been ignoring you.

Basically, there’s been a few production issues with the game that we’ve been trying to juggle. Before we announced the bad news to you, we wanted to see if there was anyway we could fix it — but sadly it looks like that’s not possible.

updates.update_userinfo: SOON TO BE SNEAKING INTO YOUR HOMES
updates.update_content:
Well — it sounded a lot better in our heads.
What we meant to say was: good news everyone! We managed to raise over $330,000, officially bringing our new creation to life!

Well would you look at that. You’ve gone and broken another one of our lovely, lovely targets. Looks like you’ve left us no choice. It’s time to reveal…
THE FINAL STRETCH-Y GOAL
Like a stoney-faced villain in Scooby-Doo, it’s time to pull the mask off our final stretch goal and end this madness once and for all. So, without further ado, here it is:
We keep setting up targets, you keep knocking them down. It’s a very nice feeling, so here’s a brand new Stretchy Goal to say thank you. It’s called the ‘GAME NIGHT’ pack!

updates.update_userinfo: STRETCHY GOAL 1.5 — YOU’VE GOT DON’T GET GOT!
updates.update_content:
Hello backers!
You might’ve heard that we made a large-ish mistake with the shipping costs. In our last update, we explained how we’ll be trying our best to reduce these costs by playing around with the distribution and swapping around some plans. We are pleased to announce new, lower shipping costs to the below countries:
UK: £8

Hello everyone,
Looks like we got got… by ourselves. How embarrassing.
Despite being a UK company, we launched this campaign with the expectation that most of the backers would be based in America. We planned to manufacture the games in the US, then ship from there to supporters around the world.

support.title: GRUB party for 200 guests at YOUR PLACE!
support.descp:
We will bring our pop up bar, sound system with DJ and a bunch of grub to wherever you are*! Please message us before pledging for this reward just to double check we can do everything you need and we have the required dates available.
*Must be in Greater Manchester! If you are from further afield message us and we'll sort something.

support.title: Guided street art tour from Skyliner
support.descp: This reward entitles the backer to two spaces on the Skyliner walking tour 'The Modern History of the Northern Quarter' which explores Manchester heritage, architecture and the issues facing the city through discovering the original ceramic art trail alongside more modern street art. Full details of the tour and dates can be found at http://www.theskyliner.org/tour-dates/. The tour finishes at GRUB at which point you will be provided with food and drink for two to round your day off.

support.title: Dinner for two at Yakumama
support.descp: This reward entitles you to food for two plus a bottle of wine at the tremendous Yakumama Cantina and Bar in Todmorden. ***ONLY ONE REWARD AVAILABLE***

support.title: Brewery Experience at Runaway Brewery
support.descp:
Join Runaway Brewery and Steep Soda to help design and brew a special one off Shandy for the garden launch party.
The brew day will take place at The Runaway Brewery on Saturday April 4th (9am - 4pm). The reward includes lunch and a drink at Grub Food Fair plus a few beers at Runaway Brewery during the brew day.

support.title: Manchester Punk Festival x2 + GRUB
support.descp: This reward entitles you to two weekend tickets to the spiffing Manchester Punk Festival 2020. Not only that but each day of the fest you can come to GRUB and enjoy food and drink for two. Tidy. ***ONE REWARD ONLY***

support.title: William Exley dog portrait
support.descp: Our lovely illustrator Will Exley will draw a portrait of your dog in just the same style we already have of Boris, Lupin, Stanley, Kami & Tommy in our basement bar. We'll then print and frame two copies, one for you to take home and one for us to display proudly in our basement bar. This item will be available for collection from GRUB once created.

support.title: Recording day at Voltalab Sound Studios
support.descp: If you are a musician this is the reward for you! This entitles you to one day of recording at Voltalab Sound Studios in Rochdale. On top of that you can launch your new recording at GRUB in one of our performance spaces with an acoustic gig (venue only available Monday to Thursday). Check out the lovely studio facilities and services up for grabs at https://www.voltalab.co.uk/. ONE REWARD ONLY SO ACT QUICKLY IF YOU FANCY IT!

support.title: GRUB GOLDEN TICKET
support.descp: Come and enjoy street food & drink for two every Friday & Saturday for the summer (1st weekend of May to last weekend of September) in our smashing finished venue. Please note the GOLDEN TICKET is not transferrable to other people.

support.title: PLANT POWERED GOLDEN TICKET
support.descp: Come along to enjoy street food & drink for FOUR every Sunday for the summer (1st weekend of May to last weekend of September) in our delightful finished venue. Please note the GOLDEN TICKET is not transferrable to other people.

campaign.story:
Oceans is a 2-4 player strategy game in the Evolution game series where you create a vibrant web of marine life through millions of years of evolution. Whatever version of Oceans you pledge for, it will automatically come with a 5-6 player expansion.
The Evolution games are known for vivid themes, easy rules, and hidden depth. With many thousands of play-tests, years of non-stop design, over 100 unique illustrations, and more content than we've ever put into a game before, Oceans is our most ambitious project to date.
At the game's start, the only food source is plankton, the foundation of the ocean food web. It populates the beautifully illustrated Reef and Ocean boards, shown here as prototypes: 
(Note the fish tokens you see above are off-the-shelf items we used for testing. The actual tokens will be cardboard for the standard edition and acrylic for the deluxe edition. See below.)
Your goal is to create and evolve species so they find their niche in the growing ecosystem, by giving them helpful combinations of traits. This is a what a species looks like: 
Each species is defined by its population (the fish tokens above), and its traits (the cards above). Through the game It'll gain and lose traits, and gain and lose population depending on what it can eat, and what can eat it. Despite your best efforts, some species will go extinct! It's natural selection at work. 
Because you can build species from any combination of traits, thousands of species are possible, and they all interact in their own particular ways as the ecosystem builds. Every game creates a one-of-a-kind world, never to be seen again.   
Many species will be predators, each bigger than the next, all the way up to the dreaded apex predator. But some will eat in other ways, for example by scavenging on the sea bottom or filter-feeding on plankton. Below are examples of trait art - each a watercolor painting by famed nature artist Catherine Hamilton:
Then there's a whole other side to the game. It's called The Deep. 
Huge regions of deep ocean are unexplored, and what little we've seen of them can seem like fantasy:
We had to put this mysterious world into the game. Hence The Deep.
The Deep will contain, at minimum, 50 unique, powerful traits, which dramatically boost the range - and strangeness - of species you can evolve. We commissioned scores of illustrations from a variety of fine artists to make them. Here are examples:   
Through unlocked stretch goals, at least 32 additional Deep cards may become permanently added to the game. 
Beyond those, there are also 8 foiled Deep promo cards to unlock. These foiled traits are more aggressive and/or complex than the other cards in the game. 
With all stretch goals unlocked, you'll get more than 90 unique Deep cards in total. They raise the number of distinct species you can evolve from thousands to about one million.
Each time you play, there are 2 scenario cards in play (chosen at random at the start of the game from a deck of at least 25). Each creates a major ecosystem-shift when activated, altering the whole game. It's another way the evolutionary timeline changes each play.
The standard scenario deck can create about 600 distinct Ocean histories to evolve through, but we're also offering up to 13 more scenario cards as stretch goals. With those added, about 1500 Ocean histories are possible. 
We've packed all this into rules that are simpler, more intuitive, and easier to teach even than Evolution, which was already known for being easy to teach. Nonetheless you'll find tons of hidden tactics and strategies...under the surface. 
Note: Oceans is mechanically quite different from previous Evolution games. See this update for details.  
 For every pledge level, at the end of the campaign, you'll choose between English, French, Spanish and Italian versions of Oceans in the pledge manager. You can pledge for as many copies as you wish.
 North Star Games will publish the English version
 Funforge will publish the French version. Pour voir cette page en français, cliquez ici! 
 Schwerkraft-Verlag will publish the German Edition. 
 Ediciones MasQueOca will publish the Spanish version. You can read their updates about Oceans at their blog here.
 Pendragon Game Studio will publish the Italian version. To read about this campaign in, click here.
Standard Edition Pledge Level - $45 USD ($5 off MSRP)
You get the Oceans Standard Edition and all unlocked stretch goals. 
The Standard Edition contains:  1 Rulebook, 1 Reference Guide, 2 Player aids, 1 Reef board, 3 Ocean boards (2 small, 1 large), 120 Surface cards (10 of each type), 50-80 Deep cards (1 of each type), 24 Scenario cards, 24 Species boards, 200 cardboard fish with 6 different illustrated designs (see below), 4 Player screens, and 4 Bonus Score tokens. Note exact numbers of some components could change with final game tweaks.
The 5-6 player expansion contains 40 additional fish, 2 extra player screens, 2 extra bonus score tokens, and 10 extra species boards.  
Note: unlike in the prototype pictured above, the final cardboard fish will be illustrated on both sides: 
Deluxe Edition Pledge Level - $70 ($15 off MSRP)
You get Oceans' Deluxe Edition and all unlocked stretch goals. The Deluxe Edition improves on the Standard Edition in the following ways:
Includes 240 deluxe translucent acrylic fish tokens in addition to the cardboard fish of the standard edition, so you can decide how you want to play. The acrylic fish are more durable, easier to handle, and they refract light beautifully. Our goal is to make them as delicious-looking and as tactile as possible. We'll have done our job if your first instinct is to eat them. Prototype:
The final version may look even better, as they'll have smooth, beveled edges.
Includes custom-printed, premium food bags for up to 6 players for storing your points, instead of cardboard player screens. They feel super-silky, they have drawstrings, and they help keep your playing area neat and compact. 
Includes 220 custom Oceans premium matte card sleeves, for sleeving both the core trait cards and The Deep trait cards, plus spares. 
Box Cover Art Painting Pledge Level - $3000
You get the Deluxe Edition, all unlocked stretch goals, and Catherine Hamilton's original 12" x 12" watercolor painting for the Box Cover. Because the painting is one-of-a-kind, only one backer can pledge this level: 
Pledge levels which are no longer available
There are a number of pledge levels with backer limits that have been reached, and so are no longer available. To simplify this page, we've removed descriptions of these levels for now. We'll add them back in if any become available again.
Whatever language you choose for your game, your stretch goals will also come in that language. There are three types of stretch goals: 
 Deep Cards: Unlocked Deep traits that will become a permanent part of both the Standard and Deluxe Editions. Each card that isn't unlocked may be available on our website for $2.  
 Foiled Deep Cards: Promo Deep traits that are more aggressive and/or complex than normal Deep traits. After the campaign, each foiled card may be available on our website for $3 if there are any left over. 
 Scenario Cards: Promo scenarios that are wackier than the standard scenarios. Some are downright goofy. After the campaign, each scenario card may be available on our website for $1 if there are any left over. 
The total value of all stretch goals is more than $100.
You can order as many of each add-on as you like. Note the non-digital add-ons will add extra shipping cost, which will be charged after the campaign ends in our pledge manager.
Evolution (English or Italian) - add $40 to your pledge for each English copy, $35 for each Italian copy
Evolution is an award-winning board game where 2 – 6 players adapt terrestrial species in an ever changing ecosystem with hungry predators and limited resources. The game has been used in the evolutionary biology department at the University of Oxford and featured in the world's leading scientific journal, Nature. You'll be able to choose between English and Italian versions in the pledge manager after the campaign ends.
Evolution Video Game (English Only)
Add $12 to your pledge for a Steam code (20% off). In the pledge manager at campaign's end, it may also be possible to add-on iOS and Android versions.
We've turned Evolution into a video game for iOS, Android, and Steam. It's got lots of new content and modes of play, and a refined interface. The learn-as-you-play tutorial makes it perhaps the easiest way to learn Evolution.
Evolution: Climate Standalone (English Only) - add $60 to your pledge for each copy
Climate is a more advanced version of Evolution, where you must contend not only with other species, but also with a changing climate that can swing from scorching hot to icy cold, and major environmental disruptions like drought and meteor impacts.
Evolution: The Beginning (English Only) - add $25 to your pledge for each copy
The Beginning is a faster, simpler, more casual Evolution experience than its parent game. It's especially good for playing with young kids (8 and up) and it works very well for 2 players.
Evolution Foiled Promo Card Pack #1 (English Only) - add $12 to your pledge for each pack
This pack contains 7 copies each of 5 foiled promo traits that that can be used in both Evolution and Evolution: Climate. We normally sell each trait for $5 each (and not all of them foiled). With this pack you save more than 50% on each card. The cards are: Extra Sensory Perception, Cybernetic Limbs, Gigantism, Venom, Unstable DNA.

This pack contains 7 copies each of 7 foiled promo traits that that can be used in both Evolution and Evolution: Climate. We normally sell each trait for $5 each (and not all of them foiled). With this pack you save more than 50% on each card. The cards are: Sharp Teeth, Rapid Mutation, Pest, Invasive Species, Pounce, Quills, and Last Stand.

This pack contains 7 copies each of 6 foiled promo traits that that can be used in both Evolution and Evolution: Climate. We normally sell each trait for $5 each (and not all of them foiled). With this pack you save 50% on each card. The cards are: Mimicry, Trample, Timid, Insectivore, Coprophagia, and Claws.
Premium, Custom Deep Deck Tray by Dog Might Games - add $49 to your pledge
This custom Oceans card tray is crafted by the Viking Lumberjacks at Dog Might Games. Built to fit the Deep Deck, the trays are built using Culry Birch and feature the Oceans logo fully sculpted into the wood and Dog Might's custom Azul stain. The Trays measure 12 x 3.25 x 2.75" and fit both sleeved and unsleeved cards. Like all Dog Might products, the Trays come with a lifetime guarantee. Check out more of their Gaming Gear at dogmight.com.

campaign.story:
Designing a board game requires a lot of creativity, but also some discipline when it comes to the most vital part of the process: playtesting your game. The Fail Faster Playtesting Journal will guide you throughout your playtesting process to ensure that you’re capturing the right information as well as guide you towards improving your design. 
At its core, the Fail Faster Playtesting Journal contains pages to keep track of 36 playtests. The journal is most useful if you dedicate one journal to each game that you are designing, but you could easily use one journal to keep track of all the different games you’re designing. Each section has been tested and planned for optimal use of space.
Here's an overview of what's included in this journal. Scroll down lower to see more details about each section of the journal. 
Here's a video of Jamey Stegmaier going into more detail about his thoughts on the Fail Faster Playtesting Journal.

This journal got a lot better as we achieved certain thresholds! We earned badges throughout the campaign and once we earned enough badges for a stretch goal to be unlocked, we held a poll. The poll asked if you preferred to redeem the badges for the first stretch goal, or if you preferred to wait and save up the badges for a different stretch goal. Majority prevailed! With 12 badges left at the end of the campaign, there was one more vote, but we can't edit the campaign once it's closed, so here's a snapshot of where we ended up:   
VIDEO EXPLAINING STRETCH GOALS
Here's a video explaining how the Stretch Goals work, in case this didn't make any sense! 
RED TROPHIES
Whenever we made it to the end of any row in the Stretch Goal chart, we also unlocked a RED TROPHY! Red trophies unlocked more content for the journal and didn't cost any extra badges! Here's what we unlocked:
1) Contract Checklist: A checklist of everything you need to consider before signing that contract! 
2) Blind Playtest Feedback form: A form to provide your blind playtesters to ensure you get the feedback you need. This will only be included in the PDF since it doesn't really make sense to include in the final copy of the journal. As a reminder, everyone who backs this campaign for at least 1 physical copy of the journal will also receive the PDF! 

Fail Faster is the culmination of ideas from Jay Cormier who co-designed all of the games pictured above, with many more signed to come out soon.  He has detailed his journey on how he got his games published along with Sen-Foong Lim, at www.bamboozlebrothers.com. He teaches Game Theory at the Vancouver Film School and has done so for the last 6 years.   
It's possible that content and images shown below could change by the time we go to print. Mostly this will be due to listening to feedback from you, the backers!
Playtesters and Scores: The top left corner includes spaces for name, version, number of tests and date. Then an area to write your playtesters name - including a box to indicate if it's their first time playing the game and columns to keep track of various scores, or even times when players achieve specific thresholds.
Times: Here’s where you can keep track of the time it took to explain rules and play your game and if you were able to play to the end or not.
Rules Changes and Focus: Do you have any rules changes since your last playtest that you don’t want to forget? Write them here before you start your playtest. Then keep track of any observations you have as well as any questions your playtesters asked you while playing.
Winning Strategies: Keep track of the winning player’s strategy up here to see, over time, if there are dominant strategies. There's a nice reminder here to take a photo of the end game state. This can be useful when analyzing afterwards.
Feedback: Feedback from your playtesters is written here. The questions that are asked vary on each page, and start by assuming you’re in the Alpha phase of game design and by the end of the journal, the questions are more geared towards games in the Gamma phase. 
Additional tools and resources
The journal is full of other interesting tools and resources that will help make you a better game designer.
Designer Progress 
On the fold out cover, ten behaviours have been identified that, when followed, will make you a better playtester of your game and ultimately, a better designer.
When you have accomplished one of these behaviours in your playtest, shade in the next box. When you reach a badge on any of the rows, flip open the fold-out cover and colour in that badge on the front.
If we unlock the sticker stretch goal, then the journal will come with stickers of each badge which will really pop when placed on the cover!
You can also keep track of your overall designer level by totaling up the number of badges you’ve earned from previous journals. Write in the lifetime sum total in the top of your journal. If we reach our sticker stretch goal, then there will be stickers available to indicate your level as a designer for all to see.
Game Idea Generator
The inside of the fold-out front cover contains a Game Idea Generator. Simply roll 2 dice three times to get a random Mechanic, Theme and even a Constraint. Don’t have 2 dice lying around? No worries because that’s also built into the journal.
Simply flip the journal open to any page and the bottom left corner will have a random 2d6 result. This can be handy while playtesting your game if you forgot dice. Twenty-six of the middle pages also have a random letter tile on it for those games that require a random letter.
How to Get Your Game Published (in PDF version only)
There's a guide showing you how to get your game published. 
Manufacturer Considerations

campaign.story:
Wavelength is a social guessing game where two teams compete to read each other's minds. It’s a thrilling experience of TALKING and THINKING and HIGH FIVING that anyone can play—but it also has some of that deep word game sorcery, like Codenames, where your decisions feel tense, strategic, meaningful. 
Wavelength is designed by Wolfgang Warsch, Alex Hague, and Justin Vickers. Wolfgang is the creator behind The Mind and won the Kennerspiel des Jahres award in 2018—basically the most prestigious award in tabletop games. Alex and Justin make Monikers, which the New York Times called “the perfect party game.”
The game’s stunning art is by Nan Na Hvass & Sofie Hannibal of Hvass&Hannibal.
Like the best party games, Wavelength is deceptively simple. 
Each round, one team rotates a 3D dial to where they think a hidden bullseye is located on a spectrum:
Bullseye = those 3 colored wedges
The spectrum is completely hidden by a plastic screen, BUT one player on your team—the Psychic—knows exactly where the bullseye is. Their job is to get your team to guess the location by: 
1. Drawing a card with a pair of words that represent two ends of a spectrum, like
2. Giving a clue that is *conceptually* where the bullseye is located between those two binaries
So if the card this round is “Hot - Cold,” the Psychic needs to give a clue ON THE SPECTRUM between extremely hot on the far left side to extremely cold on the far right side. And so in the example above they might give a clue like "coffee."
After the Psychic gives their clue, this when the real game begins: your team discusses where they think the bullseye is located and turns the dial to that location on the spectrum.  This is when your team has a chance to think out loud, debate, and ponder extremely dumb questions—all while the other team tries to poison your brain with bad suggestions.  
After your team “locks in” their answer, the Psychic DRAMATICALLY REVEALS the bullseye. The closer to the center you guessed, the more points your team scores!
Oh, and the opposing team ALSO gets a chance for points: before the reveal, they quickly discuss and guess whether the bullseye is to the left or right of your team's dial position and get 1 point if they're right!
It’s smart and funny and endlessly social. 
Wavelength comes with 168 different spectrums, which combine with the randomized bullseye position in an infinite number of weird and challenging and interesting combinations.
Here’s the best thing about Wavelength: when your team guesses exactly right, it feels like you all just performed an impossible magic trick together. Success feels AWESOME and unlike any game we’ve ever played.
Everyone screams and high fives. Other people in the room look over to see what just happened. People hug, sometimes. It’s wild.
Wavelength’s theme may be telepathy, but it’s secretly all about empathy. To win, your team will have to figure out how each of you thinks about the world. And talking through that will lead to some of the most oddly profound discussions like:
How ugly is a baby kangaroo?
Is stealing from orphans forgivable?
Does cotton smell good?
How hairy is David Hasselhoff?
Is pizza a sandwich?
Wavelength is the game we’ve been wanting to make for YEARS: an experience right in the middle between a think-y word game and a ridiculous party game.
The secret ingredient is that there are NO NUMBERS in the game at all. So instead of rationally debating between an 8 or 9 on a scale of 1-10, you have just this completely unquantifiable feeling of going with your gut. 
But Wavelength isn’t some loosey goosey opinion game: there’s an ironclad logic behind a great clue that feels exhilarating when your team gets a perfect bullseye.
  “The Device”: This is the main interactive element of the game. It's a fully assembled component that includes a 7.5" rotating wheel with scalloped edges for turning, the 2.5" diameter plastic dial, plastic screen w/handle for easy reveal, and front and back cardboard panels.
 84 spectrum cards: Double sided for 168 spectrums, linen finish.
 3 Scoring tokens: Cute little cardboard heads!
 Custom plastic tray: With space for expansions, debossed text for scoring.
 Rulebook: It's a rulebook.
One of the really unique things about Wavelength is that it's played entirely IN THE BOX. The cards, dial, and score tracker all slot into the box’s tray, and you just…pass it around. So you never have to worry about losing components at a bar or under your friend’s table. 
There’s NOTHING TO SORT and NOTHING TO BAG. Which makes Wavelength a breeze to set up and take down. It literally takes less than 30 seconds to get a game ready. 
There’s one more thing that makes Wavelength so special: it’s TACTILE. 
You have this big, juicy 3D plastic dial that feels incredible in your hand. It gives such a satisfying feeling of precise control rather than just guessing numbers.  
One of our MANY working prototypes, developed by the brilliant Sarah Pavis
You’ll want to turn it for the sake of turning it.
And to randomize the bullseye's location each round, instead of having to fiddle with cards every time, we've designed a game show worthy rotating wheel that the Psychic gets to turn each round before giving their clue:
The result is a game that's intuitive and playable for non-gamers and yet still feels fresh to us jaded tabletop veterans after hundreds of plays (yes, we’re obsessed). And because of the near-infinite combinations of bullseye positions and spectrum cards, you’ll want to switch up teams and play again and again and again. 
We can’t wait to get it to you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our 6th kickstarter, and we're really proud that we've delivered a solid final product every time.

And for Wavelength, we've never prototyped or tested a game this much before. We spent countless hours over the past year on the rules, card set, and physical design. 

In terms of manufacturing, this is the most complex game we've ever made, so we've also put a ton of time into making sure we can get it from idea to execution. Fortunately, we're working with Panda, who manufactures hyper complex games like Scythe. So we're in very good hands there with their engineers and logistical wizards. We've also built in a lot of cushion into our delivery estimate of October, just in case we have an even longer prototyping process. 

For fulfillment, we're working with Blackbox, who we've used to ship thousands of copies of Monikers to backers around the world.

campaign.story:
Compete to run the best Chocolate Factory! Featuring a literal engine (powered by coal), physical conveyor belts to push your tiles through (using double layered player boards), a cast of employees to hire, varied factory parts, and a huge pile of wooden and custom chocolate pieces. 
Make the best chocolate you can and sell it all to corner shops and department stores. Earn the most profit to become the champion chocolatier!
Deluxify your game!
 1. Upgrade your factory parts from mini cards to tiles (1.5mm thickness!), 
 2. The first player marker (appx 80x30mm) and Day markers (appx 20x20mm) are now specially screen printed and relatively large custom wooden shapes, 
 3. Your coal chits are now changed to black acrylic coal gems (40 in total)
 4. A premium box sleeve to top it all off!
Final stretch goals revealed. Only 2 to go!


Expert Chocolatiers kickstarter free promo set now unlocked!
Expert Chocolatiers Kickstarter free Promo pack? Now unlocked! Please see above for details.
A new "expert chocolatier" pack FREE for Kickstarter backers (and purchasable to non-backers after a minimum of 3 months of sending the game to backers) 
This new pack allows for a new employee set to be mixed in with the standard employees that do not correspond to department stores but give one off but excellent bonuses to help you achieve your targets. Featuring "The Owner", "The Helpers" and "The Prodigy".....
(names are subject to change) 
This post needs to be shared 200 times!
This picture thumbed 100 times
A GIF close up of the double layered player board conveyor belt mechanism
An example of in-game play
The prototype box! Slightly larger and 50% deeper than the Splendor box.

The deluxe edition's 3 months exclusivity will start when the first batches of games are shipping out. Alley Cat Games will be selling limited quantities at conventions such as Essen Spiel.
For 2-3 copies, the second and third copies have 5% off in the UK and USA (pledged an extra £43 for the base or £55 for the deluxe). But elsewhere the second copy comes with FREE shipping!
A literal and physical conveyor belt!
The heart of the game is a 'conveyor belt' mechanism. You'll smoothly & easily push through a series of 'conveyor belt tiles' thanks to your double-thickness player board. Each tile will start off with a cacao bean which will be upgraded by activating your factory parts to create better and tastier chocolates.
A Medium-Weight (3/5 complexity) Euro featuring literal "engine building" with a twist.
You will upgrade your factory each turn. The deliciously crunchy decisions come from choosing which factory parts to draft and where to build them.  Every factory part is unique, so there are a ridiculous number of possibilities! Discovering combinations that work together will help you make the best chocolates you possibly can! 
A 'packet drafting' mechanism.
Deny your opponents employees to help establish yourself as the #1 supplier of a department store. Even without taking that card yourself!
A delicious theme!
With lovely chocolate-resembling custom wooden pieces and colours inspired by old British chocolate. The game will be appeal to fans of the world's favourite sweet treat.
Designed by established and award winning designers
Both Matt Dunstan and Brett J Gilbert are award winning designers having been nominated for the Kennerspiel des Jahres for their smash hit: Elysium. Both have a large array of published and popular hobbyist games and Alley Cat Games are privileged to be working with them.
Download the latest non-final rulebook here
Download the basic print and play files here! Contains VERY basic artwork!
Play an early artwork version of Chocolate Factory on TTS! Wanna play with one of the team? Comment in the comments section!
Each player chooses factory parts and employees. If you choose a 'packet' of cards, you only keep 1. This way, you can deny other players a card that you might not want yourself.
The employees give you special abilities for this turn only but the factory parts last for the rest of the game! Each turn, you get more coal to run your machine but use it wisely to gain the most benefit.

Each factory part can only interact with the adjacent tile. You really need to think about where you place each factory part to create an efficient engine
One by one, use each factory part to convert, multiply or upgrade the chocolate in front of itself. Spend the coal depicted and then carry out the operation.

Each round, you will 'Load, push, then operate' at least 3 times. This lets you get a good amount of new chocolate, as long as you use your coal wisely!
Now you can use all the chocolate that you have generated to fulfil your personal corner shop contracts. 

But don't forget about those lucrative department stores! The employee you picked will have a connection to one of the department stores which lets you sell there for the current turn. You may fulfil the contract with a department store as many times as you wish. At the end of the game, there are bonuses for the main suppliers of each department store.
Designed by Matt Dunstan and David Digby.
The solo variant is a clear win or lose game. In the "Factory Manager" solo mode, you will play the role of the production manager in the chocolate factory. You will not deal with profits but - instead - completing all the work necessary to meet the demands of the owner and their customers. 
Think your weekly target looks tough? Well, the owner is going to be piling on more orders every day, testing your factory layout and employees to the max! Fail to complete every order? Get fired, and lose the game!
Played with 26 demand and weekly target cards. 
Demand cards require players to do a variety of specific actions or sales
Graded difficulty, play in easy/medium/hard mode
Win/Lose system. No "beat your own score" system here.
Setup differences:
1. Deal 1 weekly target
2. Deal 2 demand cards
Play differences: 
Draft phase altered to make choices more difficult.
Cleanup phase differences:
1. Players may now keep up to 6 chocolates instead of the usual 2.
2. A NEW demand card is added each round from rounds 1-4.
Win/Lose?
Players must complete ALL 6 demand cards by the end of the game otherwise you will be fired and lose!

Transparency guarantee
With every game we have funded on Kickstarter, we have kept backers informed of all the problems, issues, and - of course - good news as we get the games finished, manufactured and sent to your door. This project will be no different. We don't believe in updates for the sake of them, but we aim for an update once a week during a campaign, and once every 2-3 weeks after the campaign is over.
Get it before retail
Lab Wars and Cauldron Master, our first two games, were delivered on time or even early! Dice Hospital was held up at customs and faced a few manufacturing issues, but we in turn delayed the retail launch to put our backers first. Coral Island's deluxe version will not be in general retail until backers have had it for many months. Backers are always our priority.
World class manufacturing
This is a game of premium wooden components. For this project, we are using Longpack, who manufactured Dice Hospital for us and gave us some fantastic wooden doctor meeples. 
Shipment and Fulfilment
We will be shipping most - if not all - the games from our UK Alley Cat Games HQ via our business Royal Mail account. Unlike Dice Hospital, we will NOT be using GamesQuest for fulfilment. If Brexit happens and free trade is no longer possible between UK and EU, we will send some games to EU to be fulfilled from within. As such, the game should be customs-friendly for all EU and UK backers. It is likely US shipping will be done from within the USA using QML - this ultimately depends on a number of factors, but we will keep everyone informed of course.

PLEASE NOTE: If there are any delays it could push this back farther for completing fulfilment. The above is an optimistic prediction. We always add extra time to our tiers' estimated delivery dates - as delays can happen. Therefore a realistic prediction is that people's games arrive in October - as we have indicated in the tiers themselves.
ESSEN SALES: We will be taking some copies to sell at Essen Spiel 2019. We will guarantee IF your copy cannot arrive before Essen, but you or a friend are attending Essen, you/they can pick it up from Essen itself.

campaign.story:
2 Games in 1 box!
To offer you the maximum value we decided to bundle two games in one box. Both games utilise dice stacking as the predominant mechanic in the game (and needed a serious number of dice), but dice-stacking is explored in completely different ways!
Coral is a 3D pattern recognition game
In Coral, you have your own dice but place them on a shared board. Create shapes in 3D, utilising not only your own dice (the coral!) but your opponents' dice! 
Islands is a fresh take on set collection and drafting game
Using dice stacking, move around neutral dice (representing land). During each turn, you will draft one set of cards. How many cards you take dictates how far you can move a die. A single card from the cards you took is kept, to help establish the end-drafting.
A fresh take on dice stacking and coral themed games
We absolutely love dice stacking games such as Blueprints and coral themed games like Reef, but both Coral and Islands are highly interactive takes on these mechanics/themes. There is no "take that" and both games are family-friendly.
High Replayability
Coral and Islands come with more cards than you'll use each game. In Coral, different shape cards are used depending on the experience levels of the players per game, while in Islands, using only 3 of the 6 rule breaking specialists ensures each game is played completely differently from the last.
Solo mode for Coral
Coral (but not Islands) has a solo mode! You will play against "Nature". See the solo mode below for more details!
If you previously backed Dice Hospital, you can* receive The Inspector - a specialist promo card for Dice Hospital for free with your pledge! Importantly, please read how to receive this with your pledge below...
It features a new one-time only ability and Sabrina Miramon has captured the likeness of Tom Vasel for the upcoming Dice Tower Kickstarter campaign. This is a special thank you to everyone who backed that previous project. For those who bought Dice Hospital through other means (or who don't wish to back this project) the promo card will be available for sale in the future. Alternatively, if you bought Dice Hospital not via the Kickstarter or our website, you can share this campaign on social media and we will add it to your pledge for free too! Again you will need to message us please :)
*If you backed Dice Hospital, please send us a direct message via this campaign to ensure you get this promo card; otherwise it is not guaranteed.
*Please note, that the final number of cards in the Coral mini expansion is still TBC.
Shape-creation in 3D space
Every placement matters. 

You will have to consider every angle, perhaps walking around or at least looking from other sides to consider other perspectives - literally!
Real interaction on a shared board
You are 'growing' shapes not only using your own dice, but also other players'. Each die you place could be a blocking move, or - if you're not careful - could actually help someone else grow a high-scoring shape!  
'Fish tokens' mitigate luck and give you extra turns!
 Fish tokens, collected throughout the game, let you mitigate some of the minor luck in the game.

Fish tokens allow you to change your dice, or place both dice at once.  Used judiciously, they reward skilful play!
A feeling of growth and accomplishment
By the end, you've all made a beautiful coral reef, using the translucent dice!
A complex puzzle in a short playtime
Every turn is a thoughtful puzzle. Can you make a shape immediately? Can you make progress towards a larger shape? Is it worth using your fish to place an extra die? 
The entire game, once you've played a few times, takes about 10 minutes per player. Even including teaching time, a first game with 4 players is usually over within an hour - meaning you can play it a 2nd time, or fit it in at the end of an evening.
A new way of thinking
Movement can quickly change what colour a given pile will be allocated to.  It's all about keeping your options open and keeping an eye on what everyone else is doing. 
6 unique rule-breaking 'specialists' for varied games
There are 3 piles of land cards you can choose from. Each is tied to one specialists power. 
An fresh take on drafting
Normally when you draft in games you take the card and use them immediately or later. In Islands that is still the case, but the cards you discard have an impact on how far you can move the dice. By having land cards underneath specialists (and therefore activating their ability when taken) it can make the difference between a good move, and great move.
Each is wildly different, so the 20 different setups all feel unique.
Thanks to Polyderon Collider for this awesome gif!
You have 2 dice to potentially place. Dice can only cover lower numbers, but 1's are wild.
You can spend fish tokens before you place a die to add/subtract 1 from its value, gamble by rerolling it, or even place two dice on the same turn!
Collect a card if the die that you place lets you complete a shape! You've earned those points!
You get a fish if you didn't manage to make a shape. If you were the first to play on a fish square or you bring a stack to the maximum height, you get another fish.
Finish your turn by rolling new dice so you have 2 ready for your next turn
At the end of the game, add up all the values of your shape cards and whoever has the highest total is the winner!
Click to download the basic rulebook for Coral!
Click here to land on the page with the Coral PnP!
*Please note in this video Tom unfortunately should receive a fish token every time he does not score a card (in addition to reaching the highest level of a stack  (3) and landing on fish tokens). This is by far the most normal way to receive fish, and would have made his game much easier to mitigate. 
Thanks to Polyderon Collider for this awesome image of "final game-state"!
Choose a pile of cards. 
Keep 1 in a personal area. This affects this turn's movement and final scoring.
Move a die. The colour of the card you kept determines what colour of die you can choose. Increase its value. 
The number of cards in the pile determines how far it can move. Dice move over other dice of lower numbers.
Specialists let you break rules in various ways.
That's all you do on a turn!
At the end of a game, look at each colour 1-by-1. Whoever kept the most cards of a colour keeps the tallest piles with that colour on top. Take all the dice in a pile!
Whoever has the most dice is the winner!
Click to download the basic rulebook for Islands!
Click here to land on the page with the Islands PnP!

The Deluxe edition contains extra mini-expansions for Coral (but not Islands)
If you are easily able to visualise the shapes, add the 3D module straight away! 

It's a bit trickier to 'see', and rewards you for exploring the 3rd dimension. It also means that the final boards look even prettier, as it leads to more intertwined shapes.
The live coral expansion is all about the coral on the top of each stack! 

You will be rewarded for making shapes or using particular numbers when viewing the board from above, regardless of what the height of each stack is. We are thoroughly exploring this idea and taking it in 2 directions - the fast flowing module is all about quick objectives that sit alongside your usual target shapes and replace a couple of them. 

The deep module offers you far more points per card, but these patterns might take you most of the game to set up. 

We are still making last-minute changes to this expansion. You will see preview cards and full rules in due course.
We are finalising the solo mode for Coral. You take turns as normal, whilst 'nature' continues to grow. Nature has no objectives, but simply helps and hinders you as it will.
You are trying to make all the shapes selected when you begin. With a few different challenges, this will be a fun way to play with the framework of the game when alone.
Rules will be freely available soon.
Coral's solo mode is compatible with the 3D shapes expansion but there is no solo mode for Islands.
For written reviews scroll down to the written reviews section below!
*The deluxe edition is Kickstarter exclusive for 6months after being sent to backers! We will however, continue to allow pre-orders on our website, and sell it directly at conventions (once backers have received their copies). 
To save on shipping costs you can order our other established games to come with your copy of Coral Islands. 
Please note, we will NOT be using a pledge manager for this campaign, but we can still take orders/pre-orders after the campaign.

We always offer excellent rates for retailers around the world. If you are a retailer, please send us a message with your store email address and we will send you our rates!
For groups of 10 or more people, we are happy to provide group pledge discounts, as long as the games are sent to a single location. Prices will severely vary between location (due to shipping and customs) so please message us for rates. 
Unfortunately, we won't be able to offer group pledges for some countries in Asia, so please message us beforehand so we can check.
We are subsidising shipping and absorbing some of the cost of each shipment, so we can offer shipping within UK/USA at no additional cost!
Costs elsewhere are shown in the approximate local currency. To double check the pricing to your region or for more accurate pricing, please go to to the tier and select your country.
Due to previous shipping issues, we do not ship to South America, Mexico, Russia, and all of the Middle East (in particular UAE, or Saudi Arabia).
We do not charge additional shipping after the kickstarter! You will not have to pay anything more!
Transparency guarantee
With every game we have kickstarted, we kept backers informed of all the problems, issues, and - of course - good news as we get the games finished, manufactured and sent to your door. This project will be no different. We don't believe in updates for the sake of them, but we aim for an update twice a week during a campaign, and once every 2-3 weeks after the campaign is over.
Get it before retail
Lab Wars and Cauldron Master, our first two games, were delivered on time or even early! Dice Hospital was held up at customs and faced a few manufacturing issues, but we are in turn delaying the retail launch to put our backers first. Coral Island's deluxe version will not be in general retail until backers have had it for many months. Backers are always our priority.
World class manufacturing
This is a dice game and we taking steps to ensure we have good quality, beautifully translucent dice. For this project, we are considering Longpack, who manufactured Dice Hospital for us. Given we are using "standard components" we don't anticipate there being any issues during manufacturing, but sometimes things do happen.
Shipment and Fulfilment
We will be shipping most - if not all - the games from our UK Alley Cat Games HQ via Royal Mail. If Brexit happens and free trade is no longer possible between UK and EU, we will send some games to EU to be fulfilled from within. As such, the game should be customs-friendly for all EU and UK backers.
An optimistic prediction of the timeline:
February: KS completes, Chinese New Year 
March: Submit Files to manufacturer 
April: Manufacturing
May: Shipping from China to the UK begins 
Mid-late June: Arrives in ports 
Early July: Fulfilment commences 
August: Fulfilment completed. Most backers have their copies.
PLEASE NOTE: If there are any delays it could push this back farther for completing fulfilment. The above is an optimistic prediction. We always add extra time to our tiers' estimated delivery dates - as delays can happen.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As always with our campaigns, we cannot prevent "god like" failures such as thunderstorm, hurricanes etc.

We can promise you though that we will do everything in our power to keep everyone updated, and will stick to the original plan if at all possible.

We have lots of previous experience running projects. We are a capable and knowledgeable company. Customer service has always been our number one priority.

Brexit is a new potential obstacle that we might have to deal with. Worst case scenario, we will have WTO terms for import/export with EU and customs will become an issue. ACG does have the cash reserves to absorb the potential extra cost of the game and - worst case scenario - we will send several cases of the game back into EU.

We have worked out a plan to hopefully send the games to EU backers before Brexit, but this can't be guaranteed. If we do get the games as planned, EU backers will be sent games earlier.

We will be selling the games at UKGE - but only if backers can get their games first, or at worst, pick up their games at the UKGE.

We are a very open company and welcome feedback, suggestions and comments either publicly or privately!

campaign.story:
Designed by Rory (11), Ben (8) and Dad Jon (45), The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang is the latest installment in the Forest Dragon Story. We hope you’ll come along for the ride!
The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang is a fast and fun game of keeping up with an ever-changing piece of music, played by a variety of characters on a variety of characterful instruments from the world of The Forest Dragon.
The musicians gather at crossroads and campfires across the forest. They produce their instruments, tune up and begin to play! They play tunes both weird and wonderful, with many a twang and bang from their array of amazing musical implements. As the tunes get faster and more complicated, the musicians wrestle to keep up and challenge each others’ musical ability.
With amazing art from Rory, Ben, and with just a little help from their dad, games-industry veteran Jon Hodgson, The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang is a fast and exciting game for the whole family!
The Forest Dragon centres around 3 special cards. On one side they have “Bang” and on the other, they have “Twang”.
There’s also a deck of 24 other cards, from which players draw a hand of 2 cards. Players must try to match the sequence shown on those special “riff” cards with the cards in their hand. They can flip one of the riff cards, or they can move one of them. If they can match a riff they "bank" that card. Or they can play a special card that has special effects. 
A round of play takes around ten minutes, and play moves around the table nice and fast!

We’ve made the game so there’s almost always something to do on your turn, so no one gets left out. And for younger players, you can just play along and have an enjoyable time. For older players though, there’s a lot more strategy - remembering who has “banked” what card, and deciding which of the possible moves is the best one on your turn adds a lot more depth.
There are 8 special cards in the Bang & Twang deck, and these cards form “the tune”. If you want to change the tune for the next game, you can take out those 8 special cards, and replace them with a different set! This makes gameplay really varied!
Bang & Twang features 6 sets of special cards - 6 “tunes”, and totals 67 cards in the box!
You can download a print and play version of Bang & Twang right now! It doesn’t have art - we’ve kept it very simple for home printing, but you can try out the first “tune”, absolutely free! Download it here: https://www.dropbox.com/
In 2016 we Kickstarted our first game together. The Forest Dragon by Rory Age 9 proved to be a huge success. We raised way more support than we expected, and doubled the size of the game through the campaign! It was an amazing ride!
The Forest Dragon was created by Rory when he was 7. He’d been thinking about games, and described the whole thing in pretty much one breath. We wrote it down and slowly over a couple of years turned it into a playable game. And with your help on Kickstarter we made it into a reality. You can buy our first game in selected stores and on line.
Clearly, this isn't really just about making another game. I want my kids, Rory and Ben to continue to learn about hard work, games design, probability, art, layout, writing rules, product design, costings and all kinds of things that are good to learn about. 
Making a game with them has been a way to show them a creative path, and how the whole world around them is someone's idea put into practice. With this second game, we’re learning about sticking with something, persistence, and all the trials and pitfalls of making that second game. Can we do it? We think so!
I really want to show the boys the reality of how games get made, and all the different processes involved. With Bang & Twang, we’re learning about what it means to make an “intellectual property” and how we approach a line of games, rather than just one game. 
Our first game was made with print on demand technology that let us order one game for each person that backed us. This time we’d like to try to go one further and make a full print run of the game, and get it deeper into more shops around the world! If we fund, it means we’ll make the game through print on demand once again. And we’ll be very happy with that. But if we can reach some of our stretch goals, we’ll be able to make a more fancy box, and do a whole print run, which will be a big learn for the boys! (Dad has made many such boxed games in his day job, so you’re in safe hands!)
To help build towards our goal we had some great Add-Ons. These are extra things you can pledge for. If you decide you’d like an Add-On, then up your pledge by the appropriate amount. You can pledge for them before they are unlocked if you wish - that will help them get unlocked.

If we do manage to unlock some of these Add-Ons we’ll make some new pledge levels that include them too, for your convenience.

Currently locked, but with enough backers, it’ll become available! This is basically disgusting. One of our playtesters who is old enough to know better suggested the whole game could be re-skinned as “Burp & Fart”. This will feature the adorable “Greedy Boys” characters sat in a ditch, holding a burping and farting contest. If we unlock this stretch goal we’ll make a whole new base game available as an Add-On. It will have the same rules, but all new, deeply ill-mannered card art. 
WARNING: Will contain pictures of burps and farts drawn by giddy children.
Many of our fans are friends and family who don't know much about Kickstarter. Thanks for making it this far! We love you!
Kickstarter is a website that allows project creators with an idea to pitch that idea to the audience of the Internet. There's usually a product at the heart of a Kickstarter campaign. In this case, it's the Bang & Twang game. 
If people like the idea they can pledge money to the project. If enough money is pledged in order to meet the campaign's funding goal by the end, the money is collected from your card by Kickstarter, they take a cut, and the rest is passed on to the creator. And the project is made a reality. If we don’t raise enough pledges no one gets charged. And we go away to think very hard about what we did wrong. 
To encourage and thank supporters, or "backers" as they are known, we are offering a range of Rewards and Add-Ons. These start out at the game itself, and you can get more stuff like artwork, your own expansions and more!
Another encouragement to spread the word and convince others to join in, are Stretch Goals. These are milestones which unlock extra rewards. Sometimes they allow backers to buy something new, by upping their pledge. Other times they add something to existing rewards for free. 

Throughout the period of the campaign, you can amend your pledge up and down as you see fit. Only once the campaign ends is the amount you pay locked in. So it pays to keep an eye on progress, and pledge for everything you'd like!
If you have any questions at all, please drop me (Jon) a line via PM, email, text or whatever method suits you best, and I’ll do my best to explain how to back us! Don’t be shy, we understand that Kickstarter can be daunting if you’ve never used it.
To pledge to our campaign you need to hit the Pledge button. You'll sign up to an account, decide how much you'd like to pledge, select what kind of reward you'd like - you can choose to just give to the campaign out of kindness, or you can select what you'd like to receive for your support. We'd love you to have a copy of the game.
You can throw in whatever you like above the basic pledge levels - there aren't fixed amounts you have to give.
You'll provide some payment details and, if enough people chose to support us, at the end of the campaign your card will be charged. The project creators get in touch a short time after that to collect any additional information they might need.
Following a Kickstarter campaign is a lot of fun. A community of supporters is created, who can all share their excitement and support in the comments section, as well as ask questions or make requests of the project. You'll also receive updates throughout the campaign either here or by email.
For our second campaign we’re playing it very safe - the whole of the base game is done. 5 additional Expansions are completely made. With children helping to make the core reward we needed to know they'd be able to finish the project. And they have. We just need money for printing and shipping it to you. We are not spending any time after the campaign on further development, testing or art for the core game. It’s done. This does mean we won’t go much beyond 5 additional expansions, but we feel that’s the best and most honest way to do things. We have not yet completed work on the art and graphics for “Burp & Fart” but should we be lucky enough to unlock that stretch goal we’ll get it done as soon as possible! It won’t take long.
Stretch goals are each unlocked as we reach their milestone in our funding level. If we’re lucky we’ll reveal more as the campaign progresses!
£1500 This is our basic goal. At this level, we’ll make a print on demand version of the game in a nice tuck box and send it to you with our thanks. 
We’ll reveal more stretch goals if we do well!
Praise for the Forest Dragon by Rory Age 9
Don’t just take our word for it, here are some thoughts about our first game, The Forest Dragon by Rory Age 9: 
"The Forest Dragon is a precious thing, an experience Jon Hodgson and his son Rory will treasure for years to come. And it’s a fine game to boot! We’re so lucky they decided to share it with us." - Francesco Nepitello, game designer

At its heart, there's a marvelous whimsical adventure, which had my pair (an 8 and 11-year-old) coming back for more. I knew I was onto a winner when they were picking up the cards and having games without me :) ” - Newt Newport, game designer
“The most nutritious cardgame I have ever eaten!” - Patric Götz, game publisher 
"Our Forest Dragon card game has (literally) been to the base of Mount Doom and to Hobbiton, entertained plenty of adults and children along the trek and is an absolute joy to play." - Scott Purdy, artist

"With its bright colors, fun illustrations, and easy rules, The Forest Dragon became a fast favorite in our house. It is quick enough to learn to hold my children's attention and fun enough to appeal to adults as well." - August Hahn, game designer

"This game is amazing. I like stealing items from my family, especially my brother. We usually play with the whole pack to make the game really long and exciting, and my favourite bit is the Poo Portal!" - Milla aged 7.

We've played it with small people and with my eighty-year-old parents. It's a winner with everyone. Gutted we missed out on Clarinetto." - Claire Longhurst, gamer

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’ve successfully made our first game and delivered it to people all around the world. 

We're keeping things very simple. We have our game completely planned, made and costed. Everything is already completed at a digital level, except the Burp & Fart reskin. Everything will be ready to start printing at the end of the campaign. 

Like every kickstarter creator, we’re a bit worried about shipping - the price of moving stuff around the world can change a LOT in a short time. We hope we've done our sums right.

Where we print the game will depend on how well we do. If we fund at a lower level it will be printed in the UK. If we manage to unlock the fancier version it will be printed in Europe, and dispatched worldwide from the UK.

We want to deliver in a timely fashion, using processes we understand, even if that means a lower final figure. We’re ok with this. We will not be adding any new stretch goals beyond those in our plan.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
